intro: Rhodiola wallichiana, commonly known as the Himalayan rhodiola, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Crassulaceae and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, pinkish-white flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. It is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its hardy nature. Rhodiola wallichiana is also valued for its traditional medicinal uses in Tibetan and Ayurvedic practices.
